TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 126

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 126

body.div1:
Flat Creek 10 July 1806
Moses Austin Dr.
to making 60 lights sash $12_ [$0.12i]_______________ 7. 50 to settin and putying 60 lights glass________________ 1. 20
25th Sept to filling 2 Waggon wheels $5___________________ 10. 00
10 Oct. to filling 1 Waggon Wheel 5$____________________ 5. 00
8th Nov. to 140 feet 1/2 inch plank 1$15_________________ 2. 45
18th to weather boarding 80 feet__________________________ 1. 30 to 26 feet Berge [Birch?] Boards Double $6___________ 1. 56
1807.
14 Feb to filling 2 Cart Wheels 5$______________________ 10. 00
entrd 17 to 155 feet 1/2 inch plank 2$_____________________ 3. 10 21 to two days work at the mill 2$___________________ 4.
17 March to Laying 250 feet flooring 2$50__________________ 6. 25 to 300 feet J inch plank 1$75________________________ 5. 25 _________ $57. 61 2 days Work at Dam 1$50__________________ 3. 00 _________ 60. 61
Entd on Moses Austins Books March 23 1807 Rugles a/c Settled
